description: Attach this part to a beast of burden to allow it to pull your vehicle.
A metal handle, a creature with hands could use it to push a vehicle.
A small transmitter that lets you locate the vehicle on the map.
A small but comfortable bed.
A pair of handles.  You can mount other items on top of it.
A pair of handles.  You can mount other items on top of it.
A pair of handles.  You can mount other items on top of it.
An aisle.
An aisle.
An aisle.  A hatch lets you access a cargo space beneath it.
A cloth roof.
A metal roof.
A thick metal roof.
A blade, welded to the vehicle, for cutting up zombies.
A metal spike, welded to the vehicle, to increase injury when crashing into things.
A computer system hooked up to the steering and engine of the vehicle to allow it to follow simple paths.
A battery case for storage batteries.  Allows quick removal or addition of a storage battery, if you can lift the battery.
An armored black box, a device meant to record and preserve data of a military vehicle in the field in case it gets destroyed.
A small nuclear reactor.  When loaded with plutonium cells and turned on, will generate a lot of electrical power.
//: Here it is a multiplier on power efficiency - 1 unit of plutonium is 100 units of battery

description: A small fridge.  When turned on, it will cool the food inside, extended the time until the food spoils.
//: Use average consumption, not the max on the appliance rating plate. 30W ~ 260kWh per annum

description: A small washing machine.  With detergent, water, and some electrical power, you could clean a lot of clothes.  'e'xamine the tile with the washing machine to use it.

A small dishwasher.  With detergent, water, and some electrical power, you could clean your dishesâ€¦  Or something more useful like a CBM dripping with zombie gore.  'e'xamine the tile with the dishwasher to use it.
This is an autoclave.  It's useful for sterilizing things like CBMs.  'e'xamine the tile with the autoclave to use it.

//: 200 L storage based on an average sedan trunk being around 400 L, and our cars having two tiles.  We should get a taller trunk for SUVs and similar.

description: A wooden board that keeps the water out of your boat.
Logs tied together that will keep your boat out of the water.
A rigid plastic sheet that keeps water out of your boat.
A metal sheet that keeps the water out of your boat.
A light weight, advanced carbon fiber rigid sheet that keeps the water out of your boat.
A set of leather bindings to control a creature pulling a vehicle, such as a cart.
A steering wheel and accelerator and brake pedals.
A frame containing some lights and controls.

//: 700W average assuming relatively small target-actual difference

description: Some switches and knobs to control the vehicle's electrical systems.
A metal pipe that somewhat reduces engine noise.
A belt, attached to a seat.
A bunch of electronics that make it difficult to start the vehicle without the proper key, and that will sound an alarm if you try.  The alarm can be disabled.

Electronic module that automatically switches combustion and electric engines on and off minimizing fuel consumption and optimizing power output and battery charge rate.  Must be turned on to work.  Simplified ruleset: 1. When throttling, maximize acceleration.  2. Keep battery at 90%.  3. Minimize fuel consumption.
A series of straps attached to the seat, intended to fasten together after going over your shoulders and hips and between your legs.
A sheet over a window.
A sheet across an aisle.
A water wheel.
A large water wheel with wooden supports.
A solar panel.
A small wind turbine.
A large wind turbine with stabilizing legs.  Will cause extra drag on the vehicle.
A solar panel.  Reinforced with armored glass to make it more resistant to damage.
A high performance solar panel.
A high performance solar panel.  Reinforced with armored glass to make it more resistant to damage.
A water faucet.
A towel hanger with towels.
A spiked plate that will increase the damage delivered to someone else in collisions.
A small horn.  Use the vehicle controls and select the honk option to make noise.
A horn.  Use the vehicle controls and select the honk option to make noise.
A powerful truck horn.  Use the vehicle controls and select the honk option to make noise.
An electronic noise maker.  It will automatically make noise when you drive in reverse, alerting things behind you to move out of the way.
A short door.  You can always see over it, open or closed.
A strong, short door.  You can always see over it, open or closed.
A strong door.  Solid construction means you can't see through it when closed.
A door.  A window lets you see through it when closed.

//: Based roughly on a quarter of a 2m x 1.2m pickup truck bed, assuming a reasonble amount of piling up (about 80cm, ie. sticking up around 20cm over the sides if really stacked).  Could definitely use more subtypes.

description: A cargo space for carrying livestock.  'e'xamine it to capture an animal next to you, or to release the animal currently contained.  When selecting an animal to capture, choose its tile relative to you, not the part.

A large locker for transporting smaller animals.  'e'xamine it to capture an animal next to you, or to release the animal currently contained.  When selecting an animal to capture, choose its tile relative to you, not the part.
A device for recharging batteries.  When turned on, it charges any rechargeable batteries (battery cells, lead-acid batteries, etc) placed directly in the attached storage space.
//: Only keeping a controller board running while not actively charging

description: A small, low-power consumer device for recharging batteries.  It slowly charges any rechargeable batteries (battery cells, lead-acid batteries, etc) placed directly in the attached storage space.
//: Sub-milliwatt power consumption when idle; delivers 15 watts when charging.

description: A stereo system.  When turned on, it plays music, improving your mood.
A collection of electronic bells.  Use the vehicle's controls to turn it on or off.  When turned on, it makes noise, attracting neighborhood children.

//: Epower for POWER_TRANSFER stuff is how much percentage-wise loss there is in transmission
description: Thick copper cable with leads on either end.  Attach one end to one vehicle and the other to another, and you can transfer electrical power between the two.
Very thick copper cable with leads on either end.  Attach one end to one vehicle and the other to another, and you can transfer electrical power between the two.
//: Epower for POWER_TRANSFER stuff is how much percentage-wise loss there is in transmission

description: A heavy duty tow cable, if the other end was attached to another vehicle, it could pull it.

//: Epower for POWER_TRANSFER stuff is how much percentage-wise loss there is in transmission

description: A place to sit.
A place to sit.
A benchlike place to sit.
A wooden spike, attached to the vehicle, to increase injury when crashing into things.
A door.  Has a window so you can see out of it, even when closed.
A door.  Solid construction means you can't see through it when closed.
A wooden roof.
A small electric motor.  Installed on the same frame as a door or curtain, it will allow you to remotely open the door or curtain from the vehicle controls.

A sophisticated set of electronic controls that allow you to control the vehicle from a vehicle remote while you are not in it.  You can 'e'xamine the tile to access the controls, or use the vehicle control key (default '^').

An LCD attached to one or more cameras.  When turned on, it lets you see from the cameras, but drains power from the vehicle's batteries.  You can 'e'xamine the tile to access the controls, or use the vehicle control key (default '^').
A small camera.  Will relay what it can see to a camera control station.
//: Cameras without a DVR can run on under 10W

description: A set of controls to allow a vehicle to drive itself, or you to drive it remotely using a controller.
A clock, so you know what time it is.
A funnel that will collect rainwater into the tank beneath it.
A funnel that will collect rainwater into the tank beneath it.
A funnel that will collect rainwater into the tank beneath it.
A funnel that will collect rainwater into the tank beneath it.
A funnel that will collect rainwater into the tank beneath it.
A scoop.  Use the vehicle controls to turn it on or off.  When turned on, it will scoop up any loose items that it travels over, putting them into the vehicle's storage.
A water purifier, powered by the vehicle's batteries.  You can use it to purify water in a container or in the vehicle's tanks.  'e'xamine the tile with the purifier to use it.

A plow.  Use the vehicle controls to turn it on or off.  When turned on, it will create a furrow in any dirt it travels over, making it suitable for planting seeds.  It should be placed in front of any seed drills on the vehicle.

A seed drill.  Use the vehicle controls to turn it on or off.  You can load it with seeds by examining it.  When turned on, it will drop seeds as the vehicle moves, or plant them in furrowed dirt.  It should be placed behind any plows on the vehicle, and any wheels should be placed so they won't run over the plants.

A seed drill.  Use the vehicle controls to turn it on or off.  You can load it with seeds by examining it.  When turned on, it will drop seeds as the vehicle moves, or plant them in furrowed dirt.  It should be placed behind any plows on the vehicle, and any wheels should be placed so they won't run over the plants.

An automatic reaper.  Use the vehicle controls to turn it on or off.  When on, it will cut down plants that it travels over.  It should be placed in front of any plows in the vehicle for efficient operation.  It does not include cargo space of its own so you need install a cargo space of some kind elsewhere in the vehicle.

//: No need to mention re drag - already provided by EXTRA_DRAG flag.
description: An automatic reaper.  Use the vehicle controls to turn it on or off.  When on, it will cut down plants and store them in the vehicle's cargo.  It should be placed in front of any plows in the vehicle for efficient operation.  It has internal cargo space for collecting the harvest.
A set of locks.  Attached to a suitable cargo space, it will prevent other people from accessing the cargo and taking your stuff.
A rotating, universal mount for a weapon.  If your hands are empty, you can stand on the same tile as a turret mount and 'f'ire the weapon.

A set of motor, camera, and an AI unit which allows for tracking targets, friend-or-foe identification, and firing the connected turret in full automatic mode.  When installed over the turret, it will enable auto targeting mode for said turret.
